Package be.geertvanderpijpen.thinkinginjava.examples.chapter02

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AllOps
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates operators on the different data types in Java
    Assignment
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates that attribution of objects is in fact copy of references
    2 objects are created and assigend different member field values
    After that, the second object is assigned to the first obejct
    Both of the member field values are now the same
    The first object's member field value is now changed and a print shows that this changes the second object's member field value as well, proving that only the references were copied.
    AutoInc
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the use of auto increment operators
    The program demonstrates the difference between postfix and prefix application of the operator
    BitManipulation
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the use of bitwise operators in Java
    Bool
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows the different relational and logic operators
    Casting
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates casting of values, both implicit as explicit and both narrowing as widening
    CastingNumbers
    Shows that values are truncated during cast from float or double to integer Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    EqualsMethod
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows how to compare the values of 2 objects: by using the Object.equals(Object) method
    EqualsMethod2
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows that the Object.equals(Object) method default behaviour is to compare Object references.
    Equivalence
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the fact that Object equivalence is reference-based rather then value-based
    Exponents
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows the use of exponential notation (10 to the power x) in Java
    Letter
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Contains a char member c to demonstrate aliasing during method calls
    Literals
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition Shows the impact of associated type information with literals
    Hexadecimal, octal, long, float and double type indicators are used
    MathOps
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Demonstrates the different mathematical operators in Java
    PassObject  
    Precedence
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows the precendence rules on operators
    First, a command is executed without paranthesis (default precedence)
    After that, the same command is executed with paranthesis (enforced precedence)
    The results of both of the operations are printed
    RoundingNumbers
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows howto round values instead of truncate them using the Math.round() function
    ShortCircuit
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Shows short circuiting in Java when evaluating boolean expressions
    StringOperators
    Demonstrates operators on Strings in Java, in particular the + and += operators
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Tank  
    TernaryIfElse  
    URShift
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Test of unsigned right shift
    Shows why unsigned right shift assignment in combination with short or byte is dangerous
    Value
    Part of Thinking in Java, 4th edition
    Contains one member i that is an integer.
